subroutine sort_jobs(jobs, N)
    type(jobtype), dimension(N), intent(inout) :: jobs
    integer, intent(in) :: N
    integer :: i, j
    type(jobtype) :: temp

    do i = 1, N
        do j = i+1, N
            if (jobs(i)%a > jobs(j)%a .or. (jobs(i)%a == jobs(j)%a .and. jobs(i)%b > jobs(j)%b)) then
                temp = jobs(i)
                jobs(i) = jobs(j)
                jobs(j) = temp
            end if
        end do
    end do
end subroutine

subroutine sift_down(i)
    integer, intent(inout) :: i
    integer left, right, maxindex, temp
    do
        left = 2*i
        right = 2*i+1
        maxindex = i
        if (left <= heap_size and job_heap(left) > job_heap(maxindex)) then
            maxindex = left
        end if
        if (right <= heap_size and job_heap(right) > job_heap(maxindex)) then
            maxindex = right
        end if
        if (maxindex == i) then
            exit
        else
            temp = job_heap(i)
            job_heap(i) = job_heap(maxindex)
            job_heap(maxindex) = temp 
            i = maxindex 
        end if
    end do
end subroutine

integer function partition(ar, first, last)
    type(jobtype), intent(inout) :: ar(first:last)
    integer, intent(in) :: first, last
    integer :: i, j, pivotindex
    type(jobtype) :: pivotelement

    pivotindex = first
    pivotelement = ar(pivotindex)
    i=first+1
    j=last

    do while (i <=j )
        do while (i <=j)
            if ( (ar(i)%a < pivotelement%a) .or. &
            (ar(i)%a == pivotelement%a .and. ar(i)%b < pivotelement%b) ) then
                i =i +1
            else
                exit
            end if
        end do
        do while (i <=j ) 
            if ( (ar(j)%a > pivotelement%a) .or. &
            (ar(j)%a == pivotelement%a .and. ar(j)%b > pivotelement%b) ) then
                j =j -1
            else
                exit
            end if
        end do
        if (i <j) then
            call swap_jobs(ar(i), ar(j)) i =i +1
            j =j -1
        end if
    end do
    call swap_jobs(ar(pivotindex), ar(j)) partition =j
end function partition

subroutine swap_jobs(a,b)
    type(jobtype), intent(inout) :: a,b
    type(jobtype) :: temp
    temp = a
    a= b
    b= temp
end subroutine swap_jobs

First, the Java code reads input values for N and M. Then it reads N jobs, each with a and b values. The jobs are stored in a priority queue sorted by a and then b. Then, for each day from 1 to M, it takes all jobs with a <= current day, adds their 'b' to another max-heap (as jobQ uses reverse order), and then takes the largest b from that heap to add to the count. 

In Fortran, we need to implement the same logic. But Fortran doesn't have built-in priority queues. Hmm, so I'll need to simulate that or use some existing module. The next step is, for each day i from 1 to M, we process all jobs in q where a <= i, and add their b to the jobQ (max heap for b). Then take the largest b from jobQ (since poll in reverse order).

So in Fortran, the main structures needed are the priority queues. Since Fortran doesn't have these natively, maybe we can use heaps to mimic them. 

Alternatively, maybe we can represent the first queue as a list that's kept sorted whenever elements are added. But inserting into an array to maintain sorted order might be tedious. Alternatively, since the first addition is based on a, perhaps when we read all jobs first, we can sort them by a and b, and then process in order as needed.

Ah! That's probably a better approach. Because in Java, when you use a priority queue, elements are added and the queue keeps them ordered. So perhaps the jobs can be read first into an array, sorted by a and then b, then as we process each day i, we can add all the jobs where a <=i and not yet processed yet into a max heap (jobQ). 

So the basic idea can be redone in Fortran:

1. Read N and M.

2. Read N jobs, each with a and b, store in an array.

3. Sort the array by a, then by b.

4. Then we process each day from 1 to M. 

For each day i, do:

- Advance through the sorted job list, and collect all jobs with a <= i that haven't been picked yet. Add their b to the jobQ (max heap).

- Then, if any jobs are in the jobQ (which is max-heap), take the largest b and add to cnt.

The problem then is efficiently managing the jobs that are past a<=i and not yet added to jobQ. Because in Java, the priority queue would handle the order. So perhaps the approach here is to have the jobs sorted once in the beginning and then step through them in order.

So, here's an outline:

After reading and sorting the jobs (sorted by a, then b), we can use an index (current_job_index) to track the next job in the sorted list that might be considered for the next day.

For each day from 1 to M:

- While the current job's a <= current day:

   - until we reach a job with a > current day.

- Then, if jobQ has elements, take the maximum (b), add to cnt.

Thus, this way, we can sequentially process the sorted job list.

When removing the maximum (the first element), we swap with last element and sift down.

subroutine quicksort(array, first, last)
  type(jobtype), intent(inout) :: array(first:last)
  integer, intent(in) :: first, last
  integer :: p
  if (first < last) then
    p = partition(array, first, last)
    call quicksort(array, first, p -1)
    call quicksort(array, p+1, last)
  end if
end subroutine

function partition(ar, first, last)
  type(jobtype), intent(inout) :: ar(first:last)
  integer, intent(in) :: first, last
  integer :: i, j, pivotindex
  type(jobtype) :: pivotelement

  pivotindex = first
  pivotelement = ar(pivotindex)
  i = first+1
  j = last

  do while (i <= j)
    do while (i <= j)
      ! Compare ar(i) with pivot. If ar(i) is "less than or equal", then increment i else break.
      if ((ar(i)%a < pivotelement%a) .or. &
          (ar(i)%a == pivotelement%a .and. ar(i)%b < pivotelement%b)) then
          i = i+1
      else
          exit
      end if
    end do
    do while (i <= j)
      ! similar for j
      if ((ar(j)%a > pivotelement%a) .or. &
          (ar(j)%a == pivotelement%a .and. ar(j)%b > pivotelement%b)) then
          j = j-1
      else
          exit
      end if
    end do
    if (i < j) then
      ! swap i and j
      call swap(ar(i), ar(j))
      i = i +1
      j = j -1
    end if
  end do

  ! swap pivot with j (b/c j < i)
  call swap(ar(pivotindex), ar(j))
  partition = j
end function

subroutine swap(a, b)
  type(jobtype), intent(inout) :: a, b
  type(jobtype) :: temp
  temp = a
  a = b
  b = temp
end subroutine

program main
    implicit none
    integer :: N, M, day, cnt=0, current =1
    type jobtype
        integer :: a, b
    end type jobtype
    type(jobtype), allocatable :: jobs(:)
    integer, allocatable :: job_heap(:)
    integer :: heap_size=0

    ! read N and M
    read*, N, M
    
    ! read N jobs
    allocate(jobs(N))
    do i =1,N
        read*, jobs(i)%a, jobs(i)%b
    end do

    ! sort the jobs array:
    call quicksort(jobs, 1, N)

    ! initialize the job_heap
    allocate(job_heap(N))
    heap_size=0

    ! process each day from 1 to M:
    do day=1,M
        ! first collect all jobs with a <= day:
        do while (current <= N .and. jobs(current)%a <= day)
            call add_to_heap(jobs(current)%b)
            current = current +1
        end do
        if (heap_size >0) then
            cnt = cnt + extract_max()
        end if
    end do

    write(*,*) cnt

contains

subroutine add_to_heap(v)
    integer, intent(in) :: v
    heap_size = heap_size +1
    job_heap(heap_size) = v
    call sift_up(heap_size)
end subroutine add_to_heap

subroutine sift_up(i)
    integer, intent(in) :: i
    integer :: child, parent, temp
    temp = job_heap(i)
    child = i
    do
        parent = child /2
        if (parent < 1) exit
        if (job_heap(parent) < temp) then
            job_heap(child) = job_heap(parent)
            child = parent
        else
            exit
        end if
    end do
    job_heap(child) = temp
end subroutine sift_up

integer function extract_max() result(res)
    integer :: temp
    res = 0
    if (heap_size ==0) return
    res = job_heap(1)
    temp = job_heap(heap_size)
    job_heap(1) = temp
    heap_size = heap_size -1
    if(heap_size >=1) then
        call sift_down(1)
    end if
end function extract_max

subroutine sift_down(i)
    integer, intent(inout) :: i
    integer :: left, right, largest
    do
        left = 2*i
        right = left +1
        largest =i
        if (left <= heap_size .and. job_heap(left) > job_heap(largest)) largest = left
        if (right <= heap_size .and. job_heap(right) > job_heap(largest)) largest = right
        if (largest ==i) exit
        call swap(job_heap(i), job_heap(largest))
        i=largest
    end do
end subroutine sift_down

subroutine swap(x,y)
    integer, intent(inout) :: x,y
    integer :: tmp
    tmp =x ; x=y ; y=tmp
end subroutine swap

 ! the quicksort and related functions
recursive subroutine quicksort(array, first, last)
    type(jobtype), intent(inout) :: array(first:last)
    integer, intent(in) :: first, last
    integer :: p
    if (first < last) then
        p = partition(array, first, last)
        call quicksort(array, first, p-1)
        call quicksort(array, p+1, last)
    end if
end subroutine quicksort

integer function partition(ar, first, last)
    type(jobtype), intent(inout) :: ar(first:last)
    integer, intent(in) :: first, last
    integer :: i, j, pivotindex
    type(jobtype) :: pivotelement

    pivotindex = first
    pivotelement = ar(pivotindex)
    i=first+1
    j=last

    do while (i <=j )
        do while (i <=j)
            if ( (ar(i)%a < pivotelement%a) .or. &
            (ar(i)%a == pivotelement%a .and. ar(i)%b < pivotelement%b) ) then
                i =i +1
            else
                exit
            end if
        end do
        do while (i <=j ) 
            if ( (ar(j)%a > pivotelement%a) .or. &
            (ar(j)%a == pivotelement%a .and. ar(j)%b > pivotelement%b) ) then
                j =j -1
            else
                exit
            end if
        end do
        if (i <j) then
            call swap_jobs(ar(i), ar(j))
            i =i +1
            j =j -1
        end if
    end do
    call swap_jobs(ar(pivotindex), ar(j))
    partition =j
end function partition

subroutine swap_jobs(a,b)
    type(jobtype), intent(inout) :: a,b
    type(jobtype) :: temp
    temp = a
    a= b
    b= temp
end subroutine swap_jobs
end program
